about:
The Barangay was established in 1956 when the Commanding General of the Philippine Army saw the need to provide housing area at the periphery of Fort Bonifacio for Military personnel thus Pitogo was one of the Enlisted Men’s Barrio that was created. From then on, the influx of AFP families continued to settle one after the other until the whole area became full residential community. The affairs of the Barangay was then being administratively controlled by the Post Commander of Fort Bonifacio. The first election of barangay officials was held on May 17, 1982.
Two (2) decades ago, Pitogo was branded as the “Little Tondo” of Fort Bonifacio where hoodlum and several notorious gang thrive. Now, it is a peaceful community and gained the honor being the Outstanding Barangay for the year 1991 – 1993.
mission: Thru a responsible and responsive barangay council, shall be committed to provide basic services to all its constituents, nurture peace of mind to every family and business community as well, developing a community conducive to the best and peaceful living conditions and healthy business environment, drawing peoples’ trust and their extensive participation which is indispensible in attaining the desired outcome in the implementation of multifarious programs and projects of both city and national government that will lead to a well-developed, calm and disciplined community.
vision: We, envision that Barangay Pitogo to be sustainable, well developed, high competitive, to become a part for business. A well developed residential area, whose residents are morally upright, educated and community oriented.

props.name: Slope Characteristics
props.value: Moderately undulating rolling land sloping in many direction

props.name: Land Use Trend
props.value: Military Settlement, growing residentialModerate to High
